1.description: A lawman in the Roughs, skilled with guns and Allomancy. Recently returned to Elendel after his uncle's death to inherit the family estate.

2.description: Revealed to be a Twinborn - can Push on metals (Coinshot) and alter his weight (Feruchemical iron). Struggling to adapt to noble society in Elendel.

17.description: Learns the devastating truth about Lessie's death and her true identity. Must confront his greatest enemy while dealing with this personal betrayal.

1.description: Wax's loyal deputy in the Roughs. Quick with a joke and quicker with his guns. Has a habit of 'borrowing' things.

4.description: Revealed to be a Twinborn with the ability to create speed bubbles (Allomantic bendalloy) and store health (Feruchemical gold). Expert at disguises and accents.

3.description: Steris's half-sister and a law student at the university. Fascinated by criminal investigation and eager to help with the case.

8.description: Revealed to be a Mistborn with Allomantic abilities. Proves herself capable in dangerous situations despite her academic background.

2.description: Wax's arranged fiancée from House Harms. Practical and organized, she approaches their engagement like a business arrangement.

16.description: Shows unexpected courage and loyalty when Wax's life is in danger. Reveals depths of character beyond her formal exterior.

13.description: A mysterious figure connected to the Vanishers gang. Appears to have unusual abilities that make him extremely difficult to kill.

17.description: Revealed as the man who killed Lessie and has been orchestrating the Vanisher crimes. A Twinborn with healing abilities who can survive almost any injury.

1.description: Wax's deceased wife from his time in the Roughs. Her death deeply affected him and drove him to pursue justice relentlessly.

17.description: The truth about her identity and death is revealed, showing that her murder was part of a larger conspiracy involving the Set.

18.description: A mysterious and well-dressed figure who represents the shadowy organization known as the Set. Appears to be pulling strings from behind the scenes.

2.description: Head of House Harms and Steris's father. A practical nobleman who arranged his daughter's engagement to strengthen both houses.

20.description: The god of Scadrial, formed from the combination of Preservation and Ruin. Provides guidance and support to those who serve justice.

3.description: A captain in the Elendel constabulary who works with Wax on the Vanisher case. Professional but somewhat skeptical of Wax's unconventional methods.

1.description: Wax's deceased uncle who ran House Ladrian before his death. His passing forced Wax to return from the Roughs to inherit the family responsibilities.

3.description: A university professor who lectures on law enforcement and criminal justice. Marasi's mentor and a respected academic.

2.description: Wax's devoted valet who helps him navigate the complexities of noble society. Extremely proper and well-versed in etiquette.

4.description: A constable who works under Captain Brettin. Professional and dedicated to upholding the law in Elendel.

5.description: Another constable working on the Vanisher case. Reliable officer who follows orders and investigates diligently.

6.description: A legendary figure from the past, now worshipped as a religious figure. His teachings about fighting oppression still inspire people.
Another legendary figure from the past, remembered alongside the Survivor. Known for her incredible power and role in saving the world.

2.description: Head of House Yomen and a prominent nobleman in Elendel. Involved in various business and political affairs.

4.description: One of the criminals working with the Vanishers gang. Armed and dangerous, following orders from higher-ranking members.

3.description: The engineer of the train that was robbed by the Vanishers. Witnessed the attack and provided crucial testimony.

2.description: Security personnel protecting the Ladrian estate. Professional guards who ensure the safety of the family property.
A banker who handles House Ladrian's financial affairs. Concerned about the family's debts and business arrangements.

5.description: A dock worker who witnessed suspicious activity related to the Vanisher crimes. Provides information to the investigation.

7.description: A bartender in one of Elendel's rougher establishments. Has connections to the criminal underworld and provides information.

3.description: A prominent noblewoman who attends social gatherings. Well-connected in Elendel society and aware of various rumors.

2.description: A servant working in House Harms who assists with household duties and serves during social functions.

8.description: A member of the Vanisher gang who serves as a lookout during their criminal operations. Alert and cautious.

4.description: The conductor of the train robbed by the Vanishers. Helped passengers during the attack and provided witness testimony.

5.description: A merchant whose goods were targeted by the Vanishers. Provides information about the specific items that were stolen.

11.description: A constable who participates in the investigation of the Vanisher crimes. Dependable officer who follows orders.

8.description: A high-ranking member of the Vanisher gang who helps coordinate their operations. Ruthless and efficient.

4.description: The gang member responsible for breaching train cars and safes during robberies. Skilled with explosives and tools.

8.description: A deadly accurate shooter who provides covering fire during Vanisher operations. Cold and professional.

5.description: Someone within Elendel's shipping or railroad industry who provides the Vanishers with information about valuable cargo.

4.description: The gang member who handles their escape vehicles during robberies. Expert at navigating Elendel's streets quickly.

2.description: A prominent nobleman who attends the same social functions as Wax. Involved in shipping and trade businesses.
Lord Bastien's wife who is active in noble society. Known for hosting elaborate parties and social gatherings.

3.description: An elderly nobleman with interests in the railroad industry. Often discusses business matters at social events.
Lord Winsting's wife who enjoys gossiping about current events and criminal activities in the city.

2.description: A powerful nobleman with military background. Commands respect in both business and political circles.

3.description: A veteran constable who has worked in Elendel for many years. Experienced in dealing with organized crime.

4.description: A younger constable eager to prove himself in the investigation. Takes detailed notes and follows procedures carefully.

5.description: A constable who specializes in witness interviews and gathering testimony. Good at getting people to talk.

8.description: A police sergeant who coordinates patrol units and crime scene investigations. Tough and experienced.

3.description: A wealthy passenger who was on the train during the Vanisher robbery. Traumatized by the experience but provided key details.
A businessman traveling on the robbed train. Lost valuable documents and witnessed the thieves' unusual abilities.
A security guard employed by the railroad to protect valuable shipments. Was overpowered during the robbery.

2.description: The head butler of House Ladrian who manages the estate's daily operations. Extremely proper and experienced.
The head cook of House Ladrian who prepares meals and manages kitchen operations. Known for excellent traditional dishes.
The groundskeeper who maintains the Ladrian estate gardens and grounds. Takes pride in keeping everything immaculate.
The accountant who manages House Ladrian's financial records and transactions. Concerned about the estate's debts.
A maid who works in House Ladrian, responsible for cleaning and maintaining the interior of the estate.
The butler of House Harms who assists with formal dinners and social functions. Professional and discreet.
A maid in House Harms who helps with household duties and serving during social events.

3.description: A university professor who teaches criminal psychology. Marasi attends his lectures on criminal behavior.
A fellow law student at the university who studies alongside Marasi. Interested in criminal justice.
Another law student who often studies with Marasi and Derek. Focused on legal theory and procedure.
The university librarian who helps students research legal cases and criminal procedures. Very knowledgeable about law books.

5.description: A shopkeeper whose store was broken into by criminals connected to the Vanishers. Provided information to investigators.

7.description: An elderly woman who runs a small shop in a rougher part of Elendel. Has observed suspicious activity in her neighborhood.
A street informant who sells information to whoever pays. Has connections throughout Elendel's criminal underworld.
A fence who buys and sells stolen goods. Has been approached by people trying to sell items taken in Vanisher robberies.

5.description: A dock supervisor who manages cargo operations. Noticed irregularities in shipping manifests that may be connected to the robberies.
A dock worker who loads and unloads cargo. Has seen suspicious people asking questions about valuable shipments.

4.description: A railroad company executive who is concerned about the increasing attacks on trains. Cooperates with law enforcement.
A railroad clerk who handles shipping manifests and schedules. Potentially has access to information about valuable cargo.

1.description: An outlaw from the Roughs who Wax pursued before returning to Elendel. Part of Wax's past as a lawman.
A deputy who worked with Wax in the Roughs before his return to Elendel. Reliable law enforcement officer.
The owner of a saloon in the Roughs where Wax and other lawmen would gather. Source of local information.
The local doctor in the Roughs who treated wounded lawmen and occasionally criminals. Practical medical practitioner.

2.description: A nobleman who attends social functions and discusses current events. Has interests in various business ventures.
An elegant noblewoman known for her fashion sense and social connections. Active in Elendel's high society.

3.description: A member of the historically powerful House Venture. Still maintains significant influence in Elendel's business community.

2.description: A professional musician who performs at noble parties and social events. Well-regarded for entertaining high society.
A carriage driver who transports nobles to various social events. Observant and discreet about his passengers.

4.description: A newspaper reporter covering the Vanisher crimes for the local paper. Eager to get exclusive information about the investigation.

8.description: The newspaper editor who decides what stories to publish about the Vanisher crimes. Balances public interest with accuracy.

5.description: A jeweler whose shop was targeted by criminals. Some of his stolen goods later appeared in Vanisher-related crimes.

9.description: A security guard at one of Elendel's banks. Alert for any suspicious activity that might be connected to the Vanishers.

8.description: A warehouse foreman who manages storage of valuable goods. Has noticed security issues that may be connected to the thefts.

5.description: A factory worker who produces goods that have been targeted by the Vanishers. Provides information about production schedules.
A factory supervisor who manages production of valuable goods. Concerned about security and theft prevention.

7.description: A regular patron at rough taverns who overhears criminal conversations. Sometimes provides tips to law enforcement.
Another tavern regular who drinks heavily and sometimes lets slip information about criminal activities he's witnessed.
A street vendor who sells flowers and small goods. Observes foot traffic and notices unusual people in her area.
A chimney sweep who works throughout Elendel. His job gives him access to many buildings and observations of daily routines.
A city employee responsible for lighting street lamps. Works at night and has observed suspicious nighttime activities.

4.description: A young messenger who delivers letters and packages throughout Elendel. Quick and observant about the people he serves.

11.description: A postal clerk who handles mail and packages. Has noticed unusual mailing patterns that might be connected to criminal activity.

5.description: A blacksmith who creates tools and hardware. Has been asked to make unusual metal items that might be used in criminal activities.

7.description: A gunsmith who repairs and sells firearms. Has dealt with customers seeking specific types of weapons and modifications.

10.description: A pawnbroker who buys and sells used goods. Has been offered suspicious items that may have been stolen in various crimes.

11.description: A hotel clerk who registers guests and handles room assignments. Has seen suspicious people who might be connected to criminal activities.

8.description: A cab driver who transports people around Elendel. Has picked up suspicious passengers and overheard criminal conversations.

18.description: A mysterious operative working for the Set organization. Professional and dangerous, with specific orders regarding the Vanisher operation.

19.description: Another Set operative involved in the final confrontation. Skilled in combat and equipped with advanced weapons.

14.description: The local undertaker who handles burial arrangements. Has noticed an increase in violent deaths connected to criminal activity.

16.description: A city judge who oversees legal proceedings. Concerned about the increase in organized crime and its impact on justice.
An aide to Elendel's mayor who handles administrative matters. Concerned about the city's reputation due to criminal activity.

6.description: A religious leader who provides spiritual guidance to the community. Preaches about justice and moral behavior.

8.description: A large, intimidating gang member who uses brute force during Vanisher operations. Lacks subtlety but effective at violence.

4.description: A gang member who conducts reconnaissance before robberies. Quick and observant, specializes in gathering intelligence.

8.description: A constable who patrols the rougher districts of Elendel. Has experience dealing with organized crime and gang activity.

5.description: A newer constable who is still learning the job. Eager to help but sometimes makes mistakes in procedure.

3.description: An influential noblewoman who hosts charity events and social gatherings. Well-connected in Elendel's high society.

2.description: A noble with interests in industrial manufacturing. Discusses business matters at social functions and parties.

3.description: A railroad worker responsible for operating train brakes. Was working during the Vanisher robbery and witnessed the attack.
The fireman who maintains the train's boiler and engine. Helped passengers during the robbery and provided testimony.

2.description: A secretary who handles House Ladrian's correspondence and appointments. Organized and efficient with paperwork.
The stable master who cares for House Ladrian's horses and maintains the carriages. Experienced with animals and vehicles.

3.description: A university professor who teaches legal history. Marasi sometimes attends his lectures on historical legal cases.

8.description: The dean of the law school who oversees the academic programs. Concerned about student safety during the crime wave.

5.description: A shopkeeper who sells general goods and supplies. Has noticed unusual purchasing patterns that might be crime-related.
A dock foreman who supervises cargo loading operations. Has authority over scheduling and worker assignments.

4.description: A railroad maintenance worker who repairs tracks and equipment. Has observed suspicious activity around railroad facilities.

1.description: The sheriff of the Roughs town where Wax worked. Respected lawman who relied on Wax's skills and dedication.
A blacksmith in the Roughs who made tools and horseshoes for the community. Practical craftsman who knew everyone.
The owner of the general store in the Roughs. Supplied the community with necessities and local gossip.

3.description: The wife of Lord Venture who is active in charitable organizations and social causes. Influential in noble society.

2.description: A professional waiter who serves at noble parties and social events. Observant of guests and conversations.

11.description: A city government clerk who handles official paperwork and permits. Has access to business and property records.

10.description: An insurance investigator looking into claims related to the Vanisher robberies. Professional and thorough in his work.

4.description: A telegraph operator who sends and receives messages throughout the region. Has noticed unusual message patterns.

7.description: An apothecary who sells medicines and chemicals. Has been asked for unusual substances that might be used criminally.
A fishmonger who works near the docks. Observes daily shipping activities and notices unusual cargo movements.
A baker who provides bread and pastries to the community. Popular gathering place for local news and gossip.

10.description: A cobbler who repairs shoes and leather goods. Has worked on distinctive boots that might be connected to criminals.

7.description: A seamstress who makes and repairs clothing. Has worked on disguises and unusual garments for mysterious customers.

15.description: A prison guard captain responsible for maintaining security. Concerned about criminal organizations and their reach.

16.description: A court bailiff who maintains order during legal proceedings. Has dealt with criminals connected to organized crime.

5.description: The owner of a factory that produces valuable goods. Concerned about security and theft of his products.

8.description: A night watchman who patrols industrial areas during dark hours. Has observed suspicious nighttime activities.

5.description: A ship captain who transports cargo through Elendel's canal system. Has noticed unusual shipping requests and cargo.

recaps.1: Waxillium Ladrian, a lawman from the Roughs, pursues outlaws through dangerous terrain. After a shootout, he receives news that his uncle has died and he must return to Elendel to inherit House Ladrian.
recaps.2: Wax arrives in Elendel and meets his arranged fiancée Steris Harms. He struggles to adapt to noble society while learning about his inherited responsibilities and debts.
recaps.3: At a social gathering, Wax meets Marasi Colms, Steris's half-sister who studies law enforcement. Their conversation is interrupted by news of a train robbery by the mysterious Vanishers gang.
recaps.4: Wax and Wayne investigate the train robbery scene. They discover unusual Allomantic evidence and realize the thieves are specifically targeting valuable items rather than money.
recaps.5: The investigation continues as Wax and Wayne interview witnesses and examine the robbery patterns. They begin to suspect the Vanishers have inside information about shipments.
recaps.6: Wax attends another noble function where he learns more about the city's problems with crime. Meanwhile, the Vanishers strike again with increasing boldness.
recaps.7: Wayne goes undercover to gather information about the criminal underworld. Wax struggles with his dual identity as both nobleman and lawman.
recaps.8: The investigation leads to a dangerous confrontation as Wax and Wayne track down leads in the rougher parts of Elendel. They discover the scope of the Vanishers' operation.
recaps.9: Wax faces pressure from noble society while continuing his investigation. The Vanishers' activities escalate, threatening more than just property.
recaps.10: A major breakthrough in the case reveals connections between the robberies and certain members of Elendel's elite. Wax begins to suspect a larger conspiracy.
recaps.11: Wax and his team prepare for a dangerous operation to infiltrate the Vanishers' organization. The stakes rise as innocent lives are threatened.
recaps.12: The infiltration plan goes into effect, leading to revelations about the true scope and purpose of the Vanishers' criminal activities.
recaps.13: Shocking discoveries about the Vanishers' leadership and motivations change everything Wax thought he knew about the case.
recaps.14: Wax confronts difficult truths about the past while the investigation takes several unexpected turns. Personal and professional conflicts intensify.
recaps.15: The conspiracy widens as Wax uncovers connections to powerful figures in Elendel society. The true enemy begins to reveal themselves.
recaps.16: Wax faces his greatest challenge yet as the case becomes deeply personal. Past and present collide in dangerous ways.
recaps.17: The truth about Lessie's death is revealed, forcing Wax to confront painful memories while dealing with immediate threats to those he cares about.
recaps.18: Wax and his allies prepare for a final confrontation with the true mastermind behind the Vanishers and their criminal enterprise.
recaps.19: The climactic battle takes place as Wax faces off against his enemies, using all his skills as both lawman and Twinborn to protect innocent lives.
recaps.20: In the aftermath of the final confrontation, Wax comes to terms with his place in both the noble world and his role as protector of justice.
